subject: Sales
title: Scarcity and Urgency
description: A fast breakdown of Scarcity and Urgency for builders.

hook.text: Ticketmaster shows '3 seats left!' and your heart races. You buy before thinking it through.

buildup.text: Scarcity makes things desirable. Limited availability triggers a primal fear of missing out.

discovery.text: Cialdini found that newly scarce items are valued more than things that were always rare.

twist.text: Manufactured scarcity works short term but erodes trust when buyers uncover the deception.

climax.text: Real scarcity is ethical and powerful. Genuine deadlines and true limits create honest urgency.

punchline.text: Real limits create real desire. Fake ones backfire.

quiz.question: What did Cialdini discover about scarcity?
options: Newly scarce items are valued more than always-rare ones
Scarcity has no effect on demand
